title: Can we nerf LETHALITY and not Champions?
body:
Funny how every year. The same thing happens. But instead of directly fixing the problem, we end up complicating things so it gets fixed or semi-fixed after many months.

and I just read that Talon might receive some nerfs.  Why?

First, {{item:3147}} was released, then a lot of non-assassin champs abused it. which made it a priority first item because of how loaded it is.
Then it was nerfed, but Assassins were compensated with decent buffs and they were still in good spot.

^^^^^^
This was the point where you should've stopped buffing any lethality/penetration item.
But you ended up toning down "Shield supports", Reworking "ADCs" while buffing the shit out of {{item:3036}} 

So not only you made both shield supports and adcs weaker at early stages in the game, you also introduced items that would break certain champions just by buying them{{item:3508}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3095}} 

But now that a lot of AD assassins/Casters/bruisers are 1shotting everyone, I'm sure the nerf hammer will drop on champions instead of fixing the items you broke to begin with.

If you want to keep {{item:3036}} at it's current state, then nerf the rest of lethality items {{item:3142}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3814}} From 18 to 10 at level 18.

There's already enough damage in the game and Runes, we dont need all this lethality and armor penetration to deal true damage.

replies.body: cutting the lethality on those items would just bring back {{item:3047}} being oppressive as fuck, because they already negate a good lot of auto damage and they'd go back to completely negating double lethality items. Hell, for a good while of the game, they'd probably negate _triple_ lethality as well. Spending 1100 on an item that counters enough damage from 70% of the roster has never been fun for anyone. A similar case could be made for {{item:3155}}, but {{item:3156}} is honestly a pretty crappy item when finished a lot of the time.
Then nerf ninja tabis, items shouldn't define league and the kits champions have need to be overloaded like they are now to make them viable.

Would be kind of difficult to do that without removing the armor or gutting the basic attack damage reduction tbh (which is supposed to be their niche), given {{item:1029}} gives 15 armor. To do that you'd either have to nerf Cloth Armor itself, or remove it from the Tabis recipe (getting rid of Tabi's armor altogether) and give the basic attack damage a buff to solidify their niche. 10 lethality is a _really_ hard nerf for that particular reason, given it only actually penetrates 10 armor _at level 18_.
If assassins can use hexdrinker to negate a mage's damage for a while, tabis negating two lethality items is a fair deal
Just remove Lethality in general. It's an unhealthy mechanic that promotes binary burst or be burst gameplay.
"burst gameplay" you mean like every assassin in the game?  As an adc main I hate assassins more than anything but good lord find something actually legitimate to complain about.

Why do you think riot went to such large lengths to delay assassin burst?
Talon needs to land three abilities *and* a basic attack to trigger his passive.
LB was made to delay her abilities to trigger her damage sigil.
Zed's ult has a big window from start to finish during which he can either be CCed or the target can be healed/shielded.

Don't you dare try and say Rengar jumping out of a bush/ult and instantly nuking someone with Duskblade+Stormrazor is healthy gameplay.

Still hoping with how well he's doing they just go ahead and decide to update him rather then try to "balance" him with his current kit. maybe a nerf if he's doing *too* good atm, but only with plans to do an update in the near-ish future.

Talon is busted right now so don't try to use armor pen items as an excuse. He has better wave clear than every mage in lane and can literally just permashove everyone under their own turret while he roams if he has any bad match ups. He can't even be punished for shoving his lane because he'll just spam his mana free E everytime. 

Riot already acknowledged that it's not healthy for him to be able to pick and choose every single engage on his own terms and only choose ones that are favorable to him including when he's in lane. He can keep the burst damage and roaming but his wave clear should 100% be nerfed even if lethality gets nerfed too.

Play Swain, Ahri, Ekko, Anivia or Cho. Now Talon is useless. The thing most people fail to mention is, Talon gets ahead by roaming. If your bot/top are bonobos, then he'll get an easy 1/2 kills/assists and return to lane thanks to mobis. If every lane can play safe, then Talon won't be busted but nvm that, gotta get this kill for the montage.

Anivia, Ahri, Swain and Cho generally are good counterpicks into Talon. They can neutralise his kill threat in lane and shove him in, forcing him to concede waves or even his tower sometimes in order to roam... He's just so OP that right now, they aren't functioning that purpose, hence of course he needs nerfs. Notably, to R cd and E wall cd. His problem isn't his damage, it's how he can just pick and choose every fight that occurs early game in this meta.

Nerfs to R cd might work but unless he is ahead pre-6 or it might just cause a bigger gap when he falls behind, and I doubt E cd would matter(which one, the walls on cooldown or the amount of time to jump the next wall after you jump a wall) unless you want Talon to not break away from bad fights too fast. 

Maybe a nerf to Sudden Impact(like how much time they get lethal and magic pen. after using leaps, blinks, dashes, etc. since right now for Talon and every ad that use it, it is like an extra serrated dirk for 5 seconds without an extra bonus effect, and it comes back every 4 seconds) 
or Electrocute(not sure, it's a suggestion if nerfing Sudden Impact doesn't work)

As an Ahri main i just must comment. There is no way Ahri counters Talon. NO ACTUAL WAY. Ahri is trash anyway at the moment, a 1.25-sec burst midlaner is a nightmare for her. Roaming? What? It`s not like Talon has no- cd free roaming ability, builds Youmus. Ahri totally doesn`t outroam talon.  Q ms removed + ult cd up. No way Ahri counters Talon. The opposite - yes.

Lethality isn't the reason assassins are strong.

The reason is all of the free damage they get from those items.

{{item:3147}}  - free ~150-200dmg
{{item:3087}} - Not many people build on assassins, but when they get really ahead, you see it quite a bit. Another free 100-160 dmg (barring any crit)
{{item:3095}}  - Free Crit strike on first auto
Electrocute/DH/Predator - Need I say more?

Items/runes have added so much free damage to the game, that they don't even need to land skillshots to kill someone. A simple Q ability and auto is almost enough to kill any squishy when they get their items.

Really if they're going to nerf lethality they should just straight-up remove Sudden Impact.  That rune has always been and will always be dumb.

There was once a nerf for it on the PBE but then it never happened.  This rune is still as powerful as ever and is still really dumb.

The new runes are just shit in general. I would much rather have the old rune system back, but make it free for people.

And then just make the masteries go poof, or make them simple, like +2ad per minute after 15 minutes or something small like that.

Runes/Masteries/Items are the reason the game is the way it is.
You can't nerf {{item:3036}} because that would put the nail in the coffin for any Crit marksman/adc in general
If you nerf the arp on dominiks you just buff the true damage conversion IE so crit ADCs can still tank bust....I really don't see the problem here.
{{champion:110}} gutted his Q then his items.

Dear OP

Gutting an entire class items isn't balance.

As A Riven OTP I have always despised the invention of lethality, it turned riven into a less skillfull champ simply because you could have a bronze player build a lethality item and completely take 2 or 3 people out of a fight without breaking a sweat, while in the past high tier players skillfully played around their abilities and item builds to work down the enemies health until they could all in them. Excluding season 3 Riven had an identity, she could still be potent when she was behind as long as she utilized her skills correctly but then comes the introduction of lethality and skill is thrown out the window. You can be 0/8 but since you have lethality items and they have squishies on the team, you're going to one shot the squishies, it desecrates the idea of fair skill and fair play.
Electrocute promotes landing multiple abilities. So I don't agree there, but ignite and dusk are cancer.

Difference is now that electrocute is adaptive damage it works with lethality.
 Before that thunderlords would eventually fall off due to MR runes scaling and it being strict magic dmg.
Ignite needs to not count as an ability. Problem (is on the way to being) solved.

The problem is that dealing a ton of burst damage is what assassins are designed to do, so they need lethality. I do agree that they overdid it, though. I mean people tell you to hug your turret, but sometimes you're not even safe doing that.
